edu.txstate.hearts.utils

Class RiskThresholds

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.txstate.hearts.utils.RiskThresholds

  • public class RiskThresholds
extends java.lang.Object
    Class is designed to house risk thresholds and make it easier to track and store them for use between sessions.
    Author:
    Jonathan Shelton

      • setThresholds

        public void setThresholds(float threshold)

      • evaluateRisk

        public void evaluateRisk(Card test,
                float threshold,
                double risk,
                java.util.SortedMap<java.lang.Double,Card> safeMap,
                java.util.SortedMap<java.lang.Double,Card> riskyMap,
                boolean lowRisk)
        After passing in risk, this method will compare risk against the established threshold and determine if a play is low or high risk. It also places safe or risky probabilities (and their associated cards) in separate maps for use if needed.
        Parameters:
        test - Card that probability was created with
        threshold - The currently set threshold
        risk - A double which contains probability of a card to win
        safeMap - A SortedMap for safe probabilities
        riskyMap - A SortedMap for risky probabilities
        lowRisk - A boolean that's true if risk is low
